greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Second of two trees generated by the Beatty sequence of sqrt(2).
comment: This tree grows from (L(2),U(2))=(2,6).  The other tree grows from (L(1),U(1))=(1,3).  Here, L and U are Beatty sequences.  See the comments at A183170 and A183173.
link: Ivan Neretin, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..8192
mathematica: a = {2, 6}; row = {a[[-1]]}; r = Sqrt[2]; s = r/(r - 1); Do[a = Join[a, row = Flatten[{Floor[#*{r, s}]} & /@ row]], {n, 5}]; a (* _Ivan Neretin_, May 25 2015 *)
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Dec 28 2010
